messages.content: what was the story about the developer you just told me about

Sure! The story was about **Maya**, a self‑taught developer who grew up in a small apartment and fell in love with coding after her first “Hello, World!” in Python. She built her own curriculum using YouTube, freeCodeCamp, and Stack Overflow, wrote blog posts to solidify her learning, and tackled big projects like a multiplayer browser game—learning from crashes and CORS errors along the way.

Maya later joined open‑source communities, got mentorship from a seasoned dev, created a portfolio (Garden Planner, StorySync, algorithm visualizations), and landed a junior full‑stack job at a game studio. Even now she keeps learning new languages, mentors newcomers, and works on an AI tutoring bot. The core message: curiosity, persistence, and community can turn anyone into a developer—even without a formal degree.
